TopicTitle: View history of your spacecraft events

Articles.Content:
At the moment, the spacecraft event history is displayed when you fatally crash your rocket and that the flight has officially ended.

What would be nice, however, is that you can view a history of the events at any instance of time in flight. This could be a simple "View Spacecraft History" button in the Esc menu, or a keyboard binded button that opens and closes the tab.

This history tab is very useful in events where your rocket is not doing what it was intended to do (But not necessarily result in a fatal crash, or take a while to get to it). You can then view when things went wrong and hence why. Then of course, you re-design your rocket to fix the problems.
Pressing F3 does exactly what you're asking; it shows the flight report.

Really? I never knew that . My bad for being a fool.

Now I get it...I can only access my key bindings through the Main Menu and not during flight.
Hey, but this can be a good idea too. Like a timeline for all you flights and you can see your mistakes.
